security: Disclosing that CIA received sensitive information covering communications within the Cuban government. One of these intercepted communications disclosed that a fishing boat owned by a U. S. citizen would be involved in such activity is sensitive.
summary: A memo from S. J. Papich to Mr. D. J. Brennan regarding George Spellmeyer and his fishing boat "Teresa y Julia," referencing CIA information about the boat's unusual activity between Havana and the Isle of Pines.
summary_one_paragraph: On June 15, 1962, S. J. Papich sent a memorandum to D. J. Brennan concerning George Spellmeyer, a U.S. citizen and owner of the fishing boat "Teresa y Julia." The memo references a National Security Agency (NSA) message from Havana to Washington and advises that the CIA received sensitive intelligence indicating the fishing boat was traveling between Havana and the Isle of Pines, the location of a Cuban prison; this activity was deemed unusual, and the information was directed to the attention of the Nationalities Intelligence Section.
title: GEORGE SPELLMEYER; CIA HAS NO OBJECTION TO FISHING BOAT DECLARATION AND/OR, "TERESA Y JULIA"
